intro: Porana discifera, commonly known as the disc-shaped porana, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often lobed and have a vibrant green color. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
